div.p: COVID-19 is a novel (new) form of the coronavirus that has not been seen in humans before. Information about the virus and the response to it continues to develop. More information about the virus can be found at the websites linked below.

p.a: MN Department of Health - COVID-19 website
U.S. Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) - COVID-19 website

li.p: The Counselor’s Corner - This website was created by our Mastery School Counselor Mr. Michael Rask. Here you will find resources on Social and Emotional Learning (SEL), crisis hotlines, academic links, and much more!

Food Service - Minneapolis Public Schools is providing FREE meals to any child 18 years and younger at nearly 50 locations around the city while schools are closed due to COVID-19; see where these sites are and related information.
Actively Learn is a collaborative platform for online learning where students can interact with each other through their assignments in ELA, Science, and Social Studies

IXL is a standards aligned program with grade level lessons and practice on math, reading, science, social studies, and spanish! This is usually a paid program which has been made FREE for educators during school closure.
Ohio’s Remote Learning Resource Guide is a one-stop-shop to distance learning. Here you can find a wide range of educational resources for both parents and educators.
FREE virtual field trip library from freedomhomeschooling.com and Adventures in Familyhood
Walt Disney partners with Khan Academy to bring you "Imagineering in a Box”
Khan Academy offers free lessons in math, science, computing, art and more! Teachers can assign their class lessons, or students can explore on their own!

Epic! is a digital library for children 12 and under where children can read and listen to books, it is FREE for educators (parents, ask your child’s teacher to help you get access) https://www.getepic.com/educators
Time for Kids is offering FREE digital subscriptions for the rest of the school year! Click here to go to the website to sign up!
CommonLit is an online reading library for grades 3rd - 12th at www.commonlit.org
ReadWorks is an online reading resource for grades K-12 www.readworks.org
newsela is an online resource for news articles on a wide range of standards aligned topics for grades 2-12 at www.newsela.com
Gutenberg is another online library with a wide range of free e-books that can be easily added to the google classroom at www.gutenberg.org
Tar Heel Reader has online easy reading books for K-1st graders and also allows you to write your own books for free at https://tarheelreader.org/

Actively Learn is a collaborative platform for online learning where students can interact with each other through their assignments in ELA, Science, and Social Studies at https://www.activelylearn.com/remote-learning
Science experiments you can do with things you find around the house

Virtual Marine Biology Camp by Ocean Initiative goes LIVE on their facebook page every Monday and Thursday at 1:00 pm central time (11:00 am pacific time) on their facebook page, click here to be directed. For more information on Oceans Initiative and their program visit their blog here.
newsela is an online resource for news articles on a wide range of standards aligned topics for grades 2-12 at www.newsela.com
Tilly and Frank social skills series on sharing, asking for help, and anger

Actively Learn is a collaborative platform for online learning where students can interact with each other through their assignments in ELA, Science, and Social Studies at https://www.activelylearn.com/remote-learning

Bestselling children’s author Mo Willems is teaching kids drawing on YouTube. Visit his channel here. Submit questions you have to LUNCHDOODLES@kennedy-center.org and he might answer them in one of his videos!
For support with technology related issues associated with Distance Learning, please contact helpdesk@themasteryschool.org

div.span: The Mastery School, 4021 Thomas Avenue North, Minneapolis, MN 55412
